ngiemboon: Samîɛ la kwé. Epʉ̀a Ésàlayɛ ntsèm cúʼte ńdʉa legwé, ńdeen ńké ńtúŋo yé mbʉ̀a yé, á Lámà. Afʉ̀ʼ kuʼ, Ndavîd lu ssé ńcwóŋ ńgʉa lé kwòŋotsẅɛ Palaŋ.
en: Samuel died,   and all Israel assembled to mourn for him,  # 25:1 Dt 34:8 and they buried him by his home in Ramah.  # 25:1 2Kg 21:18; 2Ch 33:20 David then went down to the Wilderness of Paran.  # 25:1 LXX reads to Maon,# 25:1 Gn 21:21; Nm 10:12; 13:3

ngiemboon: Atsɔ̌ mámbàŋa lɔ̌ɔn ńtsẅé Mawoŋ, ńgẅiin mejʉʼʉ fàʼ mé á Kamɛɛ, ńgwɔ́ ngàŋa mmó tɛʼ. À la gẅiin menjʉ̀njÿò ntsáʼ tá, ḿbiŋ ńgẅiin mvfó tàʼ ntsáʼ. À lɔ̌ɔn ńgee tÿǒsoŋ Kamɛɛ fʉʼó ŋwɛ́ lékwóon menoŋ na menjʉ̀njÿò mé.
en: A man in Maon   had a business in Carmel;  # 25:2 Jos 15:55 he was a very rich man with three thousand sheep and one thousand goats and was shearing his sheep in Carmel.

ngiemboon: Lezíŋ mámbàŋa ŋwɛ́ laa lê Nambaa, e se nzwě we gwɔ́ lê Ambigayɛɛ; à laa manzwě, ńzsé lésáŋa nò, ḿbiŋ sí. Táʼ, andúm we gwɔ́ nyìŋ, ńtiŋ ndʉ̀ʼ tɛʼ, ḿbiŋ ńgwɔ́ kwaʼ te tsɔ̌ɔn mezìŋe. À laa nyìŋ na nkenkÿo tsìŋendá Kalɛb.
en: The man’s name was Nabal, and his wife’s name, Abigail. The woman was intelligent and beautiful, but the man, a Calebite,   was harsh and evil in his dealings.

ngiemboon: Ndavîd la néŋe kwòŋotsẅɛ, ńjúʼ ngie Nambaa ne ńkwóon menoŋ na menjʉ̀njÿò mé.
en: While David was in the wilderness, he heard that Nabal was shearing sheep,

ngiemboon: Á gwɔ́ púʼu, á tsɔ́ʼ pʉ̀a pé legém, ńtúmo wɔ́b ńgɔɔn ngie: «Pi gʉa Kamɛɛ ńtsyɛʼte Nambaa né mèŋ.
en: so David sent ten young men instructing them, “Go up to Carmel, and when you come to Nabal, greet him   in my name.

ngiemboon: Pi ge kú gɔɔn né yé ngie, ngùʼu láʼ poŋo mbwó yé. Ḿboŋo mbwó yé tsìŋendá ntsèm tà mbɔɔ na kɔ̀ɔkɔ́ɔ gie à gẅiin.
en: Then say this: ‘Long life to you,   and peace to you, peace to your family, and peace to all that is yours.  # 25:6 1Ch 12:18

ngiemboon: Ngie Ndavîd ka jǔʼ páʼ à gẅiin pà kwóon menoŋ njʉ̀njÿò. Táʼ, á laa fʉ̀ʼ gie papféle menɔ̀ɔn pú laa Kamɛɛ, peg te nò tepòŋ na pɔ́b gÿo, atsɔ́ mmó yɔ́b la ké te pyé.
en: I hear that you are shearing.   When your shepherds were with us, we did not harass them, and nothing of theirs was missing the whole time they were in Carmel.  # 25:7 1Sm 23:24–25; 25:15–16

ngiemboon: Ngie à lɔɔn ńkwoŋ, á zɛ́te pʉ̀a pú, mbà pɔ́ ge shwóŋo gú. Ngie Ndavîd, sẅiŋté yé ngie à gẅiin pòŋontʉ́m nzèm pʉ̀a pé, á na yɔɔn lyɛʼɛ́ línɔ̀ɔn gie peg tǒo mvfò gù lɔɔn. Tsétsɔʼ náa yég mmó gie à kuʼu mǒ, tà mbɔɔ ye ngàŋafàʼ gù Ndavîd.
en: Ask your young men, and they will tell you. So let my young men find favor with you, for we have come on a feast   day.  # 25:8 Neh 8:10–12 Please give whatever you have on hand to your servants and to your son David.’ ”

ngiemboon: Epʉ̀a Ndavîd la gʉa tà ńkúu lejʉ́ŋ Nambaa, ḿbíte shwóŋo yé kɔ̀ɔkɔ́ɔ gie Ndavîd la gɔɔn, ńdeen ńké ńdáŋte.
en: David’s young men went and said all these things to Nabal on David’s behalf,   and they waited.  # 25:9 LXX reads and he became arrogant

ngiemboon: Nambaa tsɔ́ʼɔ mbwó pɔ́b ngie: Ndavîd ŋwɛ́ gẅie aa míŋ Yesêe aa wɔ̌? Áa na lyɛ̌ʼɔɔn, lelÿò menkwɔɔn ne fóo lejʉ́ŋ metáfàʼ pɔ́b ńkÿo!
en: Nabal asked them, “Who is David?   Who is Jesse’s son? Many slaves these days are running away from their masters.

ngiemboon: Tà à lɔɔn ńgwɔ́ mé gyá m bí mbelég yɔ̀ɔn, ńkaa ntse wɔ́ɔn, kà mbab gie mèŋ n dɔ̌ɔn ńtí pakwóon menoŋ menjʉ̀njÿò pɔ́ɔn, ńnáa mbwó pʉ̀a pie n te ne ńzsé lefǒ sɔ́b wɔ́ la?»
en: Am I supposed to take my bread, my water, and my meat that I butchered for my shearers and give them to these men? I don’t know where they are from.”

ngiemboon: Epʉ̀a Ndavîd la piŋ nzèm, ḿbíte shwóŋo yé kɔ̀ɔkɔ́ɔ gie Nambaa gɔ̌ɔn.
en: David’s young men retraced their steps. When they returned to him, they reported all these words.

ngiemboon: Á gwɔ́ púʼu, Ndavîd gɔɔn mbwó pʉ̀a pé ngie: «Awɔ̌wɔ́ɔ pí nně ncù ye!» Pɔ́ pí shÿɔ́gɔ na kwɔb wɔ́b! Kwàʼ Ndavîd pí ye. Mbàŋa mmó nkÿo lekùɔ la cʉ́me nzèm yé. Petsɔ́ pʉ̀a nkÿo pʉ́a cʉ́ʼ ńnéŋe ńne ḿbyɛ́bɛ pfwɔ̀ʼ shúm.
en: He said to his men, “All of you, put on your swords! ” So each man put on his sword, and David also put on his sword. About four hundred men followed David while two hundred stayed with the supplies.

ngiemboon: Atsɔ̌ tàʼ ngàŋafàʼ Nambaa la tó, ńgɔɔn mbwó Ambigayɛɛ, nzwě Nambaa ŋwɛ́ ngie: «Ndavîd ka fó kwòŋotsẅɛ ńtúm memántúm ngie pɔ́ tó ńtsyɛʼte táfàʼ weg, táʼ pɔ́ ka tǒ, á kẅé wɔ́b tépòŋ.
en: One of Nabal’s young men informed Abigail, Nabal’s wife, “Look, David sent messengers from the wilderness to greet our master,   but he screamed at them.

ngiemboon: Tá mbà pɛ̌ pʉ̀a la zɔɔn ńgẅiin pòŋontʉ́m nzèm peg. Á laa fʉ̀ʼ gie peg lâ pɔ̌ laa tsẅɛ, pɔ́ té tsɔ́ nò tepòŋ na peg gÿo, atsɔ́ mmó yég piŋ ńké te pyé.
en: The men treated us very well. When we were in the field, we weren’t harassed   and nothing of ours was missing the whole time we were living among them.

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ lɔ́ɔn ńtÿɔ́ʼte wég fʉ̀ʼ ntsèm, á zsǒ pɔ́ tsẅɛ́ʼ, páʼ peg la ne ḿpféle menɔ̀ɔn na mé pàga láʼ mie pɔ́ lɔ́ɔn ńtsẅé wó.
en: They were a wall around us, both day and night,   the entire time we were with them herding the sheep.

ngiemboon: Á gʉa na fʉ̀ʼɔɔn mbà á ne ńzɛ́te ngie kwaʼ gù kwaŋte páʼ ɔ̀ ge gÿo, mélàʼmie ngɔ́ʼ ge kúu na táfàʼ weg tà mbɔɔ na tsìŋendá yé ntsèm. Á gʉa na yé, mbà tsẅé yé té poŋ: Legɔɔn nò tà á júʼ, à tʉ tɛʼ!»
en: Now consider carefully   what you should do, because there is certain to be trouble for our master and his entire family. He is such a worthless fool nobody can talk to him! ”

ngiemboon: Ambigayɛɛ júʼ púʼu, é sẅɛte ḿbí mbelég ntáʼ nkÿo pʉ́a, ńkaa melùʼ tsɛ̀ɛ mentúʼ mémbʉ́a, ńkaa mbab menjʉ̀njÿò méntʉ̂a mie mé lɔ̌ɔn, ńgÿo memvòm nkǎŋ na múɔ káŋ ńgʉa ntʉ̂a, ńgÿo ngatô ntáʼ nkÿo gie mé lɔgɔ́ mentɔ̌ɔn tÿó njǔm mie mé tóŋo lê kúb ńnyɛte, ḿbiŋ ńgÿo ngatô ntáʼ nkÿo pʉ́a gie mé lɔgɔ́ mentɔ̌ɔn pÿɛ̀ ńnyɛte, ńdeen ńké ńtÿɔ́gɔ nkàʼ menzikáasè.
en: Abigail hurried, taking two hundred loaves of bread, two clay jars of wine, five butchered sheep, a bushel   of roasted grain, one hundred clusters of raisins, and two hundred cakes of pressed figs, and loaded them on donkeys.  # 25:18 2Sm 16:1; 1Ch 12:40

ngiemboon: Ńgɔɔn mbwó ngàŋafàʼ yé ngie: «Pi cʉa ńgwɔ́ mvfò, mèŋ n gwɔ́ nzèm.» À la ké te tsɔ́ nò mbwó ndúm we Nambaa gɔɔn.
en: Then she said to her male servants, “Go ahead of me. I will be right behind you.”   But she did not tell her husband, Nabal.

ngiemboon: À la kwɔ́ʼɔ ndùm nzikáasè, ńne ńcwóŋo, lekwɔʼɔ́ ne ńkʉŋe wɔ́b, Ndavîd pâ pʉ̀a pé ne ńtóo na wɛ̌ shÿó. Pâ pɔ̌ vege ḿbumte.
en: As she rode the donkey down a mountain pass hidden from view, she saw David and his men coming toward her and met them.

ngiemboon: Ndavîd la ne ńgɔɔn ngie: «Ńzsé ngie n daa páʼa éfʉa fʉa tá ḿbyɛ́b shúm mámbàŋa ŋwɛ́ kwòŋotsẅɛ tà tsɔ́ té mǒ pyé káa? À ka lɔgɔ nò tepòŋ ńtsɔ́ʼɔ piŋé nò mbòŋo gie n da gÿo!
en: David had just said, “I guarded everything that belonged to this man in the wilderness for nothing. He was not missing anything, yet he paid me back evil for good.

ngiemboon: E Ssé ge néŋ ngɔ́ʼ ntí ntí twó mèŋ páʼ á lɔɔn ńgwaa gwɔ́ mbaʼámbaʼ, mbà mèŋ n kaa zẅé mbàŋa ntsèm na tsìŋendá Nambaa wɔ́!»
en: May God punish me   and do so severely  # 25:22 1Sm 3:17; 20:13 if I let any of his males  # 25:22 Lit of those of his who are urinating against the wall survive until morning.”  # 25:22 1Kg 14:10

ngiemboon: Ambigayɛɛ la gwɔ́ tà ńgyá Ndavîd, ńdeen sẅɛte sẅɛ́ʼɛ na nzikáasè; ńŋwɔ́ʼ nnɛ́ tà zǐ yé kíbe ssé á mvfò yé.
en: When Abigail saw David, she quickly got off the donkey and knelt down with her face to the ground and paid homage to David.

ngiemboon: À la gwe mekwò yé púʼu, ńgɔɔn ngie: Mèŋ zɔ la fʉa mbà loo! Júʼ wɔ́ɔn ncwò, n gee ngàŋafàʼ gù.
en: She knelt at his feet and said, “The guilt is mine, my lord, but please let your servant speak to you directly. Listen to the words of your servant.

ngiemboon: Tsétsɔ́ʼ te líe mmó gie Nambaa gÿo lɛ̂; aa te zẅɛʼɛ́ yé, à leen ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ mmó gie lezíŋ sé lɔgɔ ńgɔɔn: lezíŋ sé ée lê Nambaa, ńdɔgɔ ńgɔɔn ngie: Te zẅɛʼɛ́ yé. Apwó ye gʉ̀gʉ̀ áa na yé. Kwàʼ mèŋ n ka te gyá pʉ̀a pie ɔ̀ ka túm wɔ́.
en: My lord should pay no attention to this worthless fool Nabal, for he lives up to his name:   His name means ‘stupid,’ and stupidity is all he knows.  # 25:25 Lit and foolishness is with him I, your servant, didn’t see my lord’s young men whom you sent.

ngiemboon: Afʉ̀ʼɔɔn la, n tyě páʼɔɔn á mvfò Cʉ̀apʉ̀a gẅie aa ntʉ̀ntʉ̀, tà mbɔɔ mvfò gù, áa yɛ̌ tá Cʉ̀apʉ̀a tɔʼɔ́ gú lépfɛte metse, mbɔɔ gú lésele ńzáʼ jù ntsaŋ. Á ne ńzɛ́te ngie megàŋmbù pú, é pie é faʼa légÿo nò tepòŋ na gù é pÿɔ́g yɔ́b páʼ Nambaa.
en: Now my lord, as surely as the Lord lives and as you yourself live #— #it is the Lord who kept you from participating in bloodshed and avenging yourself   by your own hand—may your enemies and those who intend to harm my lord be like Nabal.  # 25:26 2Sm 18:32

ngiemboon: Afʉ̀ʼɔɔn la, kẅé lepuʼú sie n dɔ̌g ńtó lénáa mbwó gù lɔɔn, ńgabte mbwó ngwàshùm gie ée nzèm gù.
en: Let this gift   your servant has brought to my lord be given to the young men who follow my lord.

ngiemboon: Tsétsɔʼ, lege nò tepòŋ gie n ka gÿo. Cʉ̀apʉ̀a ge láʼ gÿo ndá jù júʼ mboŋó; mélàʼmie ɔ̀ ne ńdÿɔ́ʼɔ ncù wé. Mé téen ńdáʼa ńgyá tsɔ́ nò tepòŋ na gù wɔ́.
en: Please forgive your servant’s offense,   for the Lord is certain to make a lasting dynasty for my lord  # 25:28 1Sm 2:35; 22:14; 2Sm 7:11,16 because he fights the Lord’s battles.  # 25:28 1Sm 18:17 Throughout your life, may evil  # 25:28 Or trouble not be found in you.  # 25:28 1Sm 24:11; Ps 7:3

ngiemboon: Nyìŋ lɔɔn ńdáʼ faʼa lézẅé gú, mbà Cʉ̀apʉ̀a Ssé jù ge pɔ́ɔnte gú. Táʼ, ńgʉa na megàŋmbù pú, á maʼa wɔ́b ngʉ̀a shʉ̀shʉ̀a páʼ lekwaʼá sàndǒon la.
en: “Someone is pursuing you and intends to take your life. My lord’s life is tucked safely in the place   where the Lord your God protects the living, but he is flinging away your enemies’ lives like stones from a sling.  # 25:29 Jr 10:18

ngiemboon: Cʉ̀apʉ̀a ge láʼ gwɔ́ tà gÿo nò mbòŋo ntsèm gie à la kaʼa mbwó gù, tà lɔgɔ gú gÿo fùɔ pa Ésàlayɛ,
en: When the Lord does for my lord all the good he promised you and appoints you ruler over Israel,

ngiemboon: ɔ̀ le gíŋe ḿvɛ wɔ́, ntʉ́m gú le gíŋe ésáʼa gú sẅɛ̀ɛ sẅɛ̀ɛ ngie ɔ̀ ka pfɛte metse, kwaʼ gù zɔ piŋ ńzáʼ jù ntsaŋ wɔ́. Cʉ̀apʉ̀a ge láʼ gwɔ́ tà gÿo nò mbòŋo na gù, ɔ̀ leen ńkímte wɔ́ɔn!
en: there will not be remorse or a troubled conscience for my lord because of needless bloodshed or my lord’s revenge. And when the Lord does good things for my lord, may you remember me your servant.”

ngiemboon: Ndavîd la tsɔ́ʼɔ mbwó Ambigayɛɛ ngie: «N nǎ ndǎg mbwó Cʉ̀apʉ̀a Ssé pa Ésàlayɛ gẅie à tumó gú mvfò mèŋ na yɔɔn lyɛʼɛ́ láʼ!
en: Then David said to Abigail, “Blessed be the Lord God of Israel,   who sent you to meet me today!

ngiemboon: N nǎ ndǎg mbwó gù, ńtí nkwaŋá mbòŋo gẅie ɔ̀ nǎ, ńdɔg ńtɔʼɔ wɔ́ɔn lépfɛte metse nyìŋ, mbɔɔ páʼ ngwɔ́ e sele ńzáʼ yɔ̀ɔn ntsaŋ.
en: May your discernment be blessed, and may you be blessed. Today you kept me from participating in bloodshed and avenging myself by my own hand.

ngiemboon: E Ssé pa Ésàlayɛ tɔʼɔ́ wɔ́ɔn légÿo nò tepòŋ na gù. Áa yɛ̌ tá n tyě páʼɔɔn á mvfò Cʉ̀apʉ̀a gẅie aa ntʉ̀ntʉ̀ ńgɔɔn ngie ɔ̀ gwéʼe péʼe ɔ̀ te sẅɛte ńtó ńkẅɛ́te wɔ́ɔn mɔ́, mbà njÿó gwaa lʉ́a, mbà mèŋ n zẅeté púɔ mbàŋa na tsìŋendá Nambaa ntsèm!»
en: Otherwise, as surely as the Lord God of Israel lives, who prevented me from harming you, if you had not come quickly to meet me, Nabal wouldn’t have had any males   left by morning light.”

ngiemboon: Ndavîd la leen ńké ńkẅé shúm sie Ambigayɛɛ la lɔg ḿbíle yé, ḿbiŋ ńgɔɔn né yé ngie: «Piŋ né mbʉ̀a gù né mbʉ́lè; n juʼú shwóŋè jú, tà ńtÿɔ́gɔ kwò mǒ.»
en: Then David accepted what she had brought him and said, “Go home in peace.   See, I have heard what you said and have granted your request.”  # 25:35 Gn 19:21

ngiemboon: Ambigayɛɛ la piŋ tà ńkúu mbʉ̀a, ńkẅɛ́te Nambaa, á gwaa gwɔ́ mbà à taŋté kwaʼ máamáa línɔ̀ɔn mefùɔ. Letʉ́m Nambaa la pú ne ńkága tɛʼ, mbà à nǔ tà ḿbím. Táʼ, Ambigayɛɛ ké te gɔɔn tsɔ́ nò né yé na wɛ̌ letsẅɛ́ʼ wɔ́.
en: Then Abigail went to Nabal, and there he was in his house, holding a feast fit for a king.   Nabal’s heart was cheerful,  # 25:36 Lit Nabal’s heart was good on him and he was very drunk, so she didn’t say anything  # 25:36 Lit anything at all  to him  # 25:36 1Sm 25:19 until morning light.

ngiemboon: Njÿó la lʉ́a, tà melùʼ maga na Nambaa, Ambigayɛɛ píte kɔ̀ɔkɔ́ɔ gie á ka cʉate éshwóŋo yé; atʉ́m yé záʼa, á gwe, à te gíŋe ŋele wɔ́.
en: In the morning when Nabal sobered up,   his wife told him about these events. His heart died  # 25:37 Lit Then his heart died within him and he became a stone.

ngiemboon: É la gwaa cʉa lyɛ̌ʼ legém, Cʉ̀apʉ̀a cúɔ Nambaa á kwé.
en: About ten days later, the Lord struck Nabal dead.

ngiemboon: Ndavîd la júʼ páʼ Nambaa kwě, ńgɔɔn ngie: «N nǎ ndǎg mbwó Cʉ̀apʉ̀a gẅie à ka tág nzèm yɔ̀ɔn na páʼ Nambaa la zoonte wɔ́ɔn, ḿbiŋ ńkúʼte wɔ́ɔn légÿo nò tepòŋ! Cʉ̀apʉ̀a ka gÿo, anò tepòŋ gie Nambaa la gÿo sẅɛ́ʼɛ twó yé.» Ndavîd la túm pʉ̀a ngie pɔ́ gʉa ńzɛ́te nò Ambigayɛɛ na lɔ́ɔnndá.
en: When David heard that Nabal was dead, he said, “Blessed be the Lord who championed my cause against Nabal’s insults   and restrained his servant from doing evil.  # 25:39 1Sm 25:26,34 The Lord brought Nabal’s evil deeds back on his own head.”  # 25:39 2Sm 3:28–29

ngiemboon: Epʉ̀a Ndavîd la gʉa tà ńkúu Kamɛɛ, ńgyá Ambigayɛɛ, ńgɔɔn né yé ngie: «Ndavîd tumó wég ngie peg tó ńzɛ́te nò jú, pi yé zɔ́ʼ.»
en: When David’s servants came to Abigail at Carmel, they said to her, “David sent us to bring you to him as a wife.”

ngiemboon: Á lu ssé ńŋwɔ́ʼ nnɛ́, é sɔb shÿó wé ssé, ńgɔɔn ngie: «N ge gÿo gwɔ́ nkwɔɔn ndè wɔ̀ɔn, n tyě páʼ n gwɔ́ e sɔg mekwò ngàŋafàʼ yé.»
en: She stood up, paid homage with her face to the ground,   and said, “Here I am, your servant, a slave to wash the feet of my lord’s servants.”  # 25:41 Mk 1:7

ngiemboon: Ambigayɛɛ la sẅɛte ńdu ssé; ńkwɔ́ʼɔ na nzikáasè, epúɔ ngùɔ méntʉ̂a cʉ́me nzèm yé, pâ megàŋafàʼ Ndavîd pú ńgʉa. Á kú ńcʉ́ʼʉ nzwě we.
en: Then Abigail got up quickly, and with her five female servants accompanying her, rode on the donkey following David’s messengers.   And so she became his wife.

ngiemboon: Á la gwaa gwɔ́ mbà Ndavîd la vɔg ńzɔ́ʼɔ Ayinowam nyìŋ Jʉzeleyɛɛ; Ayinowam pɔ́ Ambigayɛɛ pú ńgwɔ́ mezwě pé mépʉ́a.
en: David also married Ahinoam of Jezreel,   and the two of them became his wives.

ngiemboon: Mikaa míŋ Saẅi la zɔɔn ńgwɔ́ mvfò nzwě Ndavîd, táʼ tá we náa yé mbwó Paleti gẅie à laa míŋ Layíshÿè nyìŋ Ngalém.
en: But Saul gave his daughter Michal, David’s wife, to Palti   son of Laish, who was from Gallim.  # 25:44 Is 10:30
